title: A Story Of Bipolar And A Daughter's Search For Answers
teaser: In the 1920s and '30s, Dr. Perry Baird was a rising star in the medical world, but his struggle with bipolar disorder hampered his life.
contentencoded:
In the 1920s and ’30s, Dr. Perry Baird was a rising star in Boston’s medical community. But his struggle with bipolar disorder – then known as manic depression – hampered his life.

Dr. Baird left his young family and disappeared from his daughters’ lives. Mimi Baird, one of his daughters, sought out the truth about her father and has written a book about him called “He Wanted the Moon.”

Here & Now’s Lisa Mullins speaks with Baird about her book and what she discovered about her father.

  • Hear the original interview via Radio Boston

Guest

  • Mimi Baird, author of “He Wanted the Moon: The Madness and Medical Genius of Dr. Perry Baird, and His Daughter’s Quest to Know Him.”
